definition: to follow the rules/to do as instructed/to play by the book/to comply with a request
according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before
to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with

sentences.english: He had no choice but to comply, allowing the Imperials aboard.
sentences.chinese: 他別無選擇，只能照辦，同意帝國檢查隊登艦。

sentences.english: Wilco dobbs. How's the view up front ?
sentences.chinese: 照辦，多布斯。前方情況如何？
他衝着我喊‘快跑’，我照辦了。

sentences.english: Out of pressing need, the mother complies but the donator disappeared without forking up.
sentences.chinese: 迫於所需的母親照辦了，但是捐贈者卻食言消失了。

sentences.english: You must comply with it- take off those boots youwear, and draw on these of mine.
sentences.chinese: 你得照辦＿＿脫掉腳上的靴子，穿上我的。

sentences.english: That can be arranged provided you bear the additional charges.
sentences.chinese: 如貴方負擔增加的費用，那就能安排照辦。

sentences.english: I see in your face that you know I cando nothing else than this.
sentences.chinese: 我從你臉上看得出來我只能照辦，沒有別的辦法。

sentences.english: The rest will come later to comply with local laws.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，便依據當地法律照辦相關事項。

sentences.english: The usher took the paper, cast a glance upon it, and obeyed.
sentences.chinese: 執達吏接了那張紙，瞟了一眼，便遵命照辦了。

sentences.english: “The passport office is pretty expeditious when it comes to handling renewals,” Teddy said.
sentences.chinese: 在辦理展期方面，護照辦人員是很迅速的。

sentences.english: He again told us to turn back, which we did.
sentences.chinese: 他再次要求我們回去，我們也照辦了。

sentences.english: He kept with the spirit, if not the letter of the policy.
sentences.chinese: 即使沒有句句照辦，他還是遵循了這個制度的精神。

sentences.english: You asked for more detail, and we responded.
sentences.chinese: 你們希望獲得進一步細節，我們照辦了。

sentences.english: Jingyuan then asked Yu Xianyang to open handcuffs shackles, Pelle had to do.
sentences.chinese: 靜遠隨即要求打開俞顯揚的手銬腳鐐，小秋只得照辦。

sentences.english: The emperor wills it, so it must be done.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝旨意如此，故必須照辦。

sentences.english: Jack directed his light down into the shaft and asked Karen and Gnea to do the same.
sentences.chinese: 傑克將光束打入豎井，也請凱倫和妮雅照辦。

definition: to judge between right and wrong/to reason things out
to heave a sigh of relief
a fish that escaped the net (idiom)/(fig.) sb or sth that slips through the net
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
public courtroom accusation (idiom)/legal confrontation/to take sb to court/to sue
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
